website_summaries.verdict: A dining bench construction set that allows you to create your own piece of furniture (bench or table) for the home.
pros: Heavy-duty support brackets are easy to assemble with any number of types of lumber and wood pieces
cons: Wood is required to complete the table

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make cheap, sturdy benches!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to make benches for our dinning room table that did not come with seating. I love these benches!! The legs are easy to assemble and seem very sturdy holding three or more adults easily. The product is so great because you can make these benches however you would like. We made our benches just shy of 7 foot long with 2 - 2x8" boards each. We also used a hammered metal spray paint for these legs so they look like the metal legs on our table. I would recommend these to anyone wanting to make cheap, sturdy benches!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little bench!
customer_reviews.text: I love our little bench! I bought lumber from Lowes, had them cut it, stained wood, spray painted legs - easy peasy! It looks great on our front porch.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Building this bench couldn't have been easier. My kids and I spent the first part of a sunny morning staining the lumber and let it sit for a few hours. Later that evening I assembled the pieces with the screws provided and it was done. I'm thinking of buying another and the matching table to have a complete picnic set.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMomof5

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lots of flash lines, 2x4 fit is loose
customer_reviews.text: I had a slab of redwood I wanted to turn into a bench with a crossbeam, but the cheapest metal model with cross beam support was $300. So I gave these I try. I spray painted them black, because the color is really not that awesome. There are a lot of "flash lines" that are left over from the injection molding, which you either need to sand/scrape, or just don't look close. My 2x4 (which is more like 1.5x3.5, like all 2x4) sat really loosely in the slot for them, but the screws secure it pretty well, but if the screws go, it will all fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Kiest

customer_reviews.title: Use your imagination!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product! You can make just about any size - at least lengthwise - you want. I wanted a small bench for my front deck, could not find one that was inexpensive. Then I saw this product, and my son used scrap lumber from the garage, and he had the bench made in no time. Couldn't be more pleased with this product - what a great idea! You can put outdoor cushions on it, but I like the looks of it plain, and in the winter - I can use it as a bird feeding platform - just throw the seeds on it, instead of freezing while refilling the feeders!
customer_reviews.author: redlipslovey

customer_reviews.title: Great bench!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted me to send this back so he would make one. I didn't want to wait years for him to get around to it so I kept it and made it myself. I had Lowes cut the 2x4's sanded them and stained them. Screwed them in and painted on a protective coating. It took me a while b/c I wanted it to be nice as I'm using it at the kitchen table. Will update with a photo later. My kids all insist on sitting on it. Would be super quick if you were using it outside and bought treated wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: My bed is raised a bit (14" stand, 6" memory foam and regular mattress on top) so when I purchased a bookcase headboard half the shelves were covered by mattress and pillows. I found this bench kit and after checking the feedback on weight capacity, decided to make myself a riser for my headboard. It worked great. The bench is wide enough that the entire headboard is supported just as if it were sitting on the floor. instead of painting I covered the exposed wood and "legs" with wood grain contact paper to match the headboard. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Carma

customer_reviews.title: No Hardware Included
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bench near our new trampoline in the backyard. Disappointed to discover there was no hardware in the box. Luckily, I had some screws handy to put together. Descent product but one star because product did not match he description (no screws).
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these
customer_reviews.text: I bought 20 total, I was so proud of them and excited I found a bench that was reasonable and my daughter liked for her weddings. You can imagine my horror as I heard crack crack as she was saying her vows. I looked back and saw my guests on the ground! The screws were intact the legs had snapped off or bent. Super disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy bench
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy bench. I bought this bench because I was in a DIY mode. Well, my husband ended up sanding the wood and putting it together for me. It is absolutely beautiful. We use it as a front entry way bench in our home. Great bench!
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy way for non-talented folks to build a bench!
customer_reviews.text: Using this kit, and buying some 2x4s at a local hardware store (where they cut them for free), I was able to quickly assembly a bench. I ended up with three of these for seating for a Halloween project. They are very sturdy (though I also braced all three of mine together with additional 2x4s). The price is good, though if you had talent, you could probably build the legs out of 2x4s yourself for less money. I have no tools and no talent, so these worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Great idea ... but mine had a short life .
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought I liked this product . But I am glad that I waited a while before writing my review . Although initially this went together well and seemed sturdy enough ... after 6 months or so of use there is a real issue with the quality . The plastic first started to crack in each location where a screw is used to secure it to the wood sections ... soon thereafter a crack developed in an entirely different area on one of the legs . It seems as though the Suns UV rays has caused the plastic to become brittle . A 6 month life expectancy is very disappointing !
customer_reviews.author: Fire

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy!! Very happy with this product. I recommend using Bullseye 1-2-3 or Coverstain to prime and then paint with your choice of Rust-Oleum spray paint. The color choices are endless. I have built 4 of these as benches 6ft long, they are wonderful at my creek patio.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Simplistic template for a good bench.
customer_reviews.text: Solid base/template for a very simple product. Not gorgeous looking though. But fine for a outdoor/park bench. I may eventually paint them.. But it's not ugly. Just not pretty. Also, I felt the price might be a bit high. Not by much. Maybe 15$ would be more appropriate? It's just injection molded plastic with screws... Nothing fancy. But it's strong and functional. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ItsAMe_Mario

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic with my Farmhouse Table
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the kit. I ended up painting the legs to black and stained the wood slats to use on my farmhouse table. It looks SO nice and I love how I was able to customize the length to fit my table.
customer_reviews.author: Robyns Song

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love love love if I had a house would have them scattered in my back yard. I used this for outside an office so clients can sit. Very pleased with the result. Not as easy as some would make out in their reviews. If you want longer benches would recommend buying another set to use one in the middle for support. The plastic needs a lot of sanding in order for spray paint to take and not flake off but once painted looks great.
customer_reviews.author: boogiedwnbx

customer_reviews.title: Nice project, nice addition to long lasting backyard seating.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these items and when they were delivered, went to Lowe's to find what wood we wanted to use that can withstand rain, snow, hail and arid conditions with Nevada winds. We chose redwood boards. We also bought the patio chair pieces so we needed 9 12' boards. Lowes cut them into 6ft so no waste and save time to shave off for proper fitting. Next was deciding to paint, or just seal the boards. We sealed them with clear coat 2 applications,,and final application was brushing Man 0 War on them. That brought out the colors in the redwood boards. Nice final product. Took at least overall for paint to dry - 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: D. Conklin

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small bench on my front stoop I can sit on while my puppy is in the front yard. This is perfect. We made it just 24 inches wide and my husband primed and painted the plastic legs gray and then "whitewashed" the two x fours to make them the same shade. Looks great!
customer_reviews.author: JEF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to our bench needs around the fire pit
customer_reviews.text: We love these. We bought one set. My husband then bought the wood and assembled it. It was easy to put together and we loved the look so we we ordered three more. We now have four around the fire pit and they are perfect for that use! We were looking at benches and they were either cheaply made or poorly reviewed on Wayfair or very expensive to have them custom made. So glad we found these!
customer_reviews.author: ChezKern

customer_reviews.title: My husband put it together easily and quickly
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on time and the box was undamaged. My husband put it together easily and quickly, however, when put together, it wobbles a fair bit. I will be using it to put plants on one half and the other half will be used as a table to put drinks on next to a porch swing. It's really more decorative. If anyone had to sit on it though, again, it would wobble/move. Good for the price but not great.
customer_reviews.author: lilypudding

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Just add 2x4 or 2x6 and this will last you a lifetime. I don't usually write a review, in fact, this is my first review in Amazon, but this deserve a kudos to the manufacturer and it is made in the USA. I wish they will pre-paint it with various color selections. I spray paint mine with espresso brown to match the wood stain. It looks great and sturdy. See the matching chairs from the same company in the picture. The Jack Daniels looks great on top of it lol!
customer_reviews.author: DIY man

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by picture
customer_reviews.text: I was definately fooled by this picture and thought it came with brackets to make a chair as well. I didn't read the full description, and now as a result I have just two brackets for a bench, which I do not need. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: NoMercy

customer_reviews.title: Cost-effective and Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: I didnt even know this product existed, but it was just what I needed. The benches for our picnic table rotted out, and replacements were prohibitively expensive. I bought 2X4's at local hardware store (they cut the wood to the length I needed) then stained and sealed the wood before assembling. Everything was easy, easy, easy. I am very pleased with the final product!
customer_reviews.author: Jill A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a bench in our out-door shower but didn't want to use a pricy teak "store bought" bench that (1) would not hold up and would require oiling, and (2) did not come in the length we wanted. This kit made it easy to make a bench (not a table) out of pressure treated wood that will hold up, and for a great price! We will be using their "flipping bench to table" hardware for our dock's roof-top deck.
customer_reviews.author: on the go

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I will be purchasing other kits from them. The directions had a few spots that weren't exactly clear, and I can't imagine making this larger then 6ft without additional supports.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Jensen

customer_reviews.title: So easy and great
customer_reviews.text: Love this and the price is amazing. Very sturdy, very easy and looks amazing. I used an old door cut down for the top and made a farmhouse coffee table. I dry brushed the door and 2x4 in light gray and it matches the legs exactly. Looks like I bought it from a furniture store. Such a great idea. Can't wait to build more stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gradyq

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult getting a good angle to drive screws
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using this product. At first i was not sure screws provided were long enough to fit srcurely in wood. A little difficult getting a good angle to drive screws. I believe the secret is to get the right sized pilot bit for hole, then screws can be driven easily and seem to hold quite well. even for there short length. Made my bench 4 feet and is sturdier than i expected.
customer_reviews.author: randyc

customer_reviews.title: fun and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, I made a bench that can double as a coffee table. I also painted the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Gail W

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I used treated wood. The bench feels very sturdy. Overall, very happy with the purchase and the outcome. As suggested in earlier reviews, I used paint stirrers as spacers during installation. One thing to note, there is nothing underneath the legs to prevent it from sliding. I noticed when its placed on the tiled floor. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: SE141

customer_reviews.title: Just add outside treated wood
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a bench and side table for a few years. I needed something without metal as my seating area faces West. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. My husband easily cut the wood for the bench with the exact size left to complete the table.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Daniels

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves building things for our home and we have never been disappointed with any product that we have purchased from 2x4 ...
customer_reviews.text: We are basically 2x4 Basics addicts! If they make it, we own it. My husband loves building things for our home and we have never been disappointed with any product that we have purchased from 2x4 Basics! Can’t wait for it to warm up a bit more so we can enjoy our new outdoor furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2x4basics, No regrets
customer_reviews.text: I like everything manufactured by 2x4basics. Competitive, reasonable price, good packing, easy assembly, sturdy material, and most important - MADE IN U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: Dakila Balagtas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a bench for our table and bought this kit. I spray painted the legs and stained the wood. It turned out beautifully. I plan to do some for my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Holste

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench Kit
customer_reviews.text: I love these kits. This is my second purchase of the bench kit. I painted the legs brown with a spray can. I cut my 2x4’s and stained them. Then I screwed it together. Looks great, very strong and very inexpensive. Good project.
customer_reviews.author: Paul McGuire

customer_reviews.title: What great "quick" seating!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a concrete dining table for a year and haven't been able to find the right seating to go with it and this makes the perfect "good for now" seat. I used pressure treated wood and stained it with a grey stain. Next purchase is the chair version of this to make the captains seat
customer_reviews.author: BrentlyL

customer_reviews.title: Saves time -- a bench in minutes
customer_reviews.text: It makes making a bench very easy and quick. Just cut 2x4's into the length needed and screw them into these resin legs. The package includes the legs and screws. Although they say 8 feet length is possible, 5-6 feet is the practical limit. It gets too heavy when longer and the warping becomes a problem. Amazon web page description stated a lifetime warranty, but the box says 2-years. One of the leg cracked after 14 months, and they sent me a replacement immediately. Good company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: aJayM

customer_reviews.title: Great Tables/Benches!
customer_reviews.text: I’m kind of shocked but I actually made two 6’ benches to set my container vegetables on this summer. Gets them off the ground and I don’t have to bend over at all, or at least as far, to tend them. I’m going to make a shorter 3rd one to use as an outdoor coffee table in front of our bench. If I can do it, then anybody can do it!
customer_reviews.author: Tangerine

customer_reviews.title: The sturdiest, most varied table you can ever put together.
customer_reviews.text: I love the cream color, wish it came it other leg colors, but we are just going to paint the wood to match our existing patio set. We just bought two of the bench, table versions!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Get Some Brass Set Up Bar Gauge Blocks
customer_reviews.text: Spacing for backs of benches have spacing tabs. The seats themselves and tops of benches and picnic tables need manual spacers to set up.I used brass set up blocks to space as per directions.. Routed hard edges and needs sanding then staining but other wise good stuff.. need a Miter Saw to cut and extra outside screws for side tables extended on benches.
customer_reviews.author: WoodWorkingLearner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build your own sturdy picnic bench
customer_reviews.text: One of my picnic table benches fell apart from rot and I replaced it with one using this kit. Building the bench was easy. I bought 5 pieces of pressure-treated lumber. Four were 5 feet long (you can make them any length you desire) and the fifth was 6 inches shorter. Using an electric screwdriver, I was able to screw all the pieces together in no time. The bench is very stable, but also on the heavy side. If I had used cedar, it probably would have been a bit lighter. Next up is the table, which is deteriorating. I plan to use this company's kit for the table.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Stable bench
customer_reviews.text: I made a 40” bench with it. Instructions were easy to follow and the bench went together quickly. Had it for3 years now. It’s as sturdy as ever. Doesn’t tip when the other person stands up like my other benches. Very stable. Good looking. Now Im using it as a plant bench. Great size for a lot of uses.
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Custom Fit for Outdoor Shower
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a bench for an outdoor shower and had specific dimensions in mind to fill the space. I found a number of different sizes, shapes and styles of finished benches with prices in the hundred plus range. None had everything I was looking for at a price I would consider. When I came across the Hopkins I found it hit the mark on all points. The simple design, easy directions and low cost; together with the satisfaction and sense of accomplishment when finished, made it the perfect purchase. Better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Crisb

customer_reviews.title: yo dont be dumb like me and think this comes with the wood ...
customer_reviews.text: yo dont be dumb like me and think this comes with the wood too i was mad as hell and then i reread everything and i'm like dang, that's my b amazon/blitz usa. so for that i gotta give 5 stars cuz i'm a dumb*ss and the plastic things seem to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Things We Bought All Year!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband received this order and within just a few hours had a professional looking bench exactly the size he needed. We had looked and looked for something ready made that would suit our needs, but couldn't find anything that wasn't $200 or more. For our purposes we didn't need something a queen would sit on - just something near his grill so he could flop down between grill peaks/flips. Not only did this assemble easily, it looks finished and expensive. Had we known this thing existed before we bought all of our patio furniture, we would have bought the kits for those as well. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: JLMG

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: What a Great idea to make benches . What a Great product and at a Great price ! So easy to make just add the wood !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: These turned 8' 2x4 cedar boards into a very nice plant stand on my patio under my window. Couldn't have bought any kind of stand or stands for the total price on this one. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RuthChar49

customer_reviews.title: Love the table!
customer_reviews.text: Added a 2 x 4 under the table top to make it bigger, higher & stronger. Used 4 - 1 x 6's for the top to make it bigger and a 2 x 4 in the middle to add strength. Makes a perfect table for out at the lake. A nice addition is the benches. Plan to have this for MANY years! It was lower than I thought it would be, just didn't pay attention to the height of the legs when I purchased it. Beware that it's at the perfect height for big dogs!
customer_reviews.author: LifeIsGood in MN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build
customer_reviews.text: We have several 2x4 benches, tables, etc. They are easy to put together and have lasted for a few years with little sign of wear. We made 8-foot benches by purchasing three sets of (2 legs each) and using three legs per bench. They work great for our campfires when we need lots of seating. Ours sit in a wooded area year round with total exposure to cold, heat, rain, snow. Some animal chewed on one. (Why?) Beyond that, they are looking great!
customer_reviews.author: larndt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy and quick to build
customer_reviews.text: My son and I (mostly me) built two of these to give to dad and step-dad on father's day. Pretty easy and quick to build. We went to home depot to buy the wood and have it cut. So all we had to do when we got home was screw it together and sand the edges. We did not do any staining or treating, but they've held up and look great outside on the deck. I would definitely buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mammaroon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The good thing with this product is that you can be creative. You can chose the size , color or even the weight
customer_reviews.author: Bushi ken

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy To Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This set up is awesome. It's so very easy, all you need is wood of your choice. I had made a bench seat out of some reclaimed pallets and I felt like it needed a foot rest/coffee table/something I could use for additional seating during big parties. This things was picture perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: E Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Great items for the DIY family
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two pairs to make benches about 4 foot long. Have use the 2x4 products to make other yard furniture. Tough stuff plastic and 2x4s make great furniture pieces and are long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Great value for DIYers
customer_reviews.text: I love the 2x4 basics stuff. I'm using this as a TV stand on my screened-in patio, and it gets the job done. I picked up some 4' boards at Lowe's, had them cut at the store and spent about 15 minutes drilling the included screws into the boards. The quality of your bench is really up to you- which is great. This is the second 2x4 basics furniture I've picked from Amazon for outdoor use, and I will most likely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: The_cow_goes_NAY

customer_reviews.title: Good fathers okay kit for there kids and useful too
customer_reviews.text: Loved it as father. I made total 3 bench, all by myself for my kid birthday . Almost 15 kids played on theses,jumped on them so all gone well. Knowing fact that I have crafted them, helped me gained some praise
customer_reviews.author: GoDesicom

customer_reviews.title: 2x4 basics picnic bench
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of the 2x4 basics products and find them to be inexpensive, very sturdy and easy to put together. Remember, the kit only includes the plastic supports and the screws. You must buy wood, have a saw, preferably a circular saw, and a variable drill to prepare tap holes for the screws and to screw them in with a phillips screw bit. The 2x4 basics work bench is a harder to assemble, and I needed some 6 inch C-clamps to hold the initial pieces in alignment before setting the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is my final product ,used 5 Pieces of 2X4 4 foot pressure treated lumber and semi transparent stain. Keep a note one support lumber will have shorter length , I asked Home Depot guys to cut 10 inch, so mine support lumber length is 3 feet 2 inch.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: Very study it seems. Easy to assemble and the predrilled holes are accurate. Will need to see how it fairs with extended, exposed sun for awhile to be able to determine its final value
customer_reviews.author: splanet409

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea! I’m no carpenter, but I found this easy to assemble and look good!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Elwart

customer_reviews.title: 2X4 Bench
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should buy this beach and table stand. Easy to assemble. Very sturdy. I know it will last forever as the materials used are industrial strength.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben B. Morales

customer_reviews.title: 36" Porch Bench
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were good. The screws were good. I didn't strip any of them. I cut the boards and stained them before assembly which is what they recommended. It looks great on the front porch with a planter on one side and a place to sit on the other. I liked it so much I purchased the bench bracket for my next project.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quick, and a great new bench!
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of 2x4s from a previous project and needed a bench for our new catio. I was going to just build a bench but then found this kit and it was a dream come true! Just cut the wood to the size I wanted, screwed it all together and done. Couldn’t have been easier, especially with all of the hardware included. Will definitely order more to use up all my extra lumber!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: exaclty what we were looking for...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 3 pairs and made two 8 foot long benches by putting one in the middle for added support. We painted them black to match our outdoor furniture. They are great if you're after a casual look. Easy to put together. One complaint is that they don't come in other colors...we primed and painted them, but the paint scrapes off pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Vy4

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and sturdy when finished
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these three years ago, and used redwood for the boards. Bought 8' redwood 2 x 4s, cut them into 4' pieces, and made 2 benches. Easy to assemble and sturdy when finished. I keep the redwood stained, and they look like beautiful park benches in my back yard on the deck. Note - if you don't like the 'gray' color of the plastic, you should spray paint them the color of your choice BEFORE you install the lumber. I painted mine brown, which looks much nicer than the gray plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado climber

customer_reviews.title: Fun simple project
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to have a bench on the front porch. This allowed me to cut the ben to the exact size I wanted. It only takes minutes to put together and I have had numerous complements on it.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Goodie

customer_reviews.title: Great time save, looks fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Super simple to use and made a few hour job something that took about 20 minutes. I had an extension for the bit on my drill which certainly helped with some of the angles people mention. Highly recommended time save that seems quality!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Went together well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to make a bench outside the office for smokers to enjoy. As stated, you have to supply your own lumber. As it is going outside, we chose to use 2x4x8 pressure treated lumbar. There are ample high quality wood screws in the kit to make the table once you cut your wood to length. Just follow the instructions and you will have a very sturdy table. I also like that the screw notches on offset on each side to provide extra rigidity and longer life. If you get one, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to add the 2x4's to whatever length you choose
customer_reviews.text: I have built picnic tables and both bench designs and they are holding up for years. Easy to add the 2x4's to whatever length you choose. I even have some 8 feet long. I did add a support to the center of those to keep them from sagging. Some pieces still doing fine after 10 or more years.
customer_reviews.author: Wildflecken

customer_reviews.title: can you convert to wood
customer_reviews.text: i gave it 4 with the hopes that they can do this concept but in wood. I love the idea, but i like to have this as a in house dining bench and the plastic makes it look cheaper than i would like. The product is easy to put together and like i said great idea and concept since wood benches cost so much. If you can find a way to make the plastic be wood pieces then i will buy many more.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick bench maker
customer_reviews.text: These are ends of a bench. Buy and cut your 2x4s, put them in place and screw them together. It took me a total of 20 minutes to make two benches. I will buy more. I have a large family.
customer_reviews.author: LauraKLDMS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bench!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bench! I used three 2" by 4" by 10' pressure treated boards and cut them all in half, used the provided screws and I have a perfect 5ft bench. Its very sturdy and looks great. Its simple and a very ingenious kit. Its incredibly versatile, you can make any size bench you want up to 8ft. I wouldn't recommend anything longer than 6ft. It can be used as a table but its quite low even for a table. Best suited as a bench. Made in the U.S.A.!
customer_reviews.author: Tbird365

customer_reviews.title: Really simple!
customer_reviews.text: This item is much better than I anticipated. I made a 3 foot bench from 8 foot 2 x 4 cedar and had enough wood to make a small outdoor table. So I immediately ordered another set of legs. The bench is very sturdy and it looks nice. If you are thinking of making a bench, you cannot go wrong using these supports!
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Innovative and EASY!
customer_reviews.text: I made 2 6 foot benches with 2 2x6 boards for the seat. Due to the length, I did use 1.5 kits to put an extra support leg in the middle. These kits are amazing and so easy to work with. What a great idea!
customer_reviews.author: pp02

customer_reviews.title: cost
customer_reviews.text: We wanted simple to make benches that would last longer outside on wet ground. These legs are holding up longer than the wood used for the seats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea well executed; super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Buy the wood cut to size, put it in the slots, screw in the screws, done. BRILLIANT!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, saved me a ton of time. Built a bunch of these for our garage. Painted the wood prior to assembly. Made our benches 5' long. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge bargain. I was searching up and down for benches for my long wrap-around porch and I stumbled across this. I used 2x8s, painted it all black, and it looks amazing. All for under $50. I ordered a second set and am going to make another one. It looks way better in real life. The picture doesn't do it justice. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: nolarunner

customer_reviews.title: Easy project for a beginner like me
customer_reviews.text: Easy project for a beginner like me. I bought the 2x4's from Home Depot and had them cut them to size 4 planks at 5 feet long and 1 plank at 4.6 feet long (free). Stained the wood to match my patio. Waited a few days for it to dry (humidity is a beast here in FL). Drilled in the screws and I am all set! Great bench to put under my lemon tree. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: AimHigh67

customer_reviews.title: Table or Bench This Kit Makes it Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. This is the second one I purchased because I thought the first one turned out so well. I decided to make four foot benches using redwood 2 X 4s and a clear finish that shows off the beauty of the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to landscape a barren corner of my yard, but didn't want to spend a lot of money. I purchased Allied Precision Industries 270 Bird Bath along with this Anysize Table or Bench. I assembled this bench with 3 foot 2x4s. It was easy, just needed a drill and screw driver. I used it to set plants on. With this bench and bird bath and a few plants on a shepards hook, the corner of my yare looks wonderful. I have received many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Great, lasting product
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these kids for a long bench and two short benches SEVEN years ago. With alot of use through summer months. And average use all year round they have held up great, just now replacing them. Kids/husband are all 300+ pounds now, finally hears the first crack on the plastic. Looking forward to building new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It turned out totally awesome, so easy anyone can do it
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this item , a gift for my husband. It turned out totally awesome, so easy anyone can do it. Husband made a bench that, He scripted words written on top portion of the wood, And then properly sealed. Where the bench now sits at the cemetery, with that special personal touch for our loved ones. Very pleased with the outcome, Will be back for future orders
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Well packed, shipped on time, and they're easy to use. Everything came with except the wood, as advertised. We made 2 benches for our garden for them and they turned out great. We will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a really nice bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool product and ended up making a nice sturdy bench. The ONLY thing I would recommend is that it would be made a little more paint friendly. I used a primer then painted over with a color only to discover that it wanted to peel right off. After pressure washing the paint and primer off I started over with a plastic primer which still seems to not want to adhere completely. Other than that, it's a real nifty product!
customer_reviews.author: beccaL

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast. Bought 2 sets to make 2 6ft benches with 3 legs per bench for support. Assembly was quite easy. Most difficult part was finding decent wood at the local 'big box' store.! tip: 1) We DID swap out the provided screws in favor of stainless steel ones - ones provided MAY be OK, but didn't want to take a chance on rust. 2) stained the boards day before assembly, to insure complete waterproofing coverage.
customer_reviews.author: R&PQ

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with this
customer_reviews.text: Great little system for producing a sturdy, low-cost table. I spent a total of $35 to build a 4' table using 5/4"x6"x4' treated lumber and assembled the whole thing in 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Hall Of Record

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and I made royal blue covers made out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these legs to build my own benches. Ladies I did this and I am 65. Went to buy wood and had them cut it to size . Perfect and I made royal blue covers made out of the same material they use on director chairs. Water proof and works great for the grand children who go from the pool to the table to the pool...
customer_reviews.author: geb49

customer_reviews.title: i love this. I got this and the kit with ...
customer_reviews.text: i love this. I got this and the kit with the back for around the fire pit..... i like the one with the back so you can sit back but this is also very nice and sturdy and so much cheaper than other options, especially if you want a lot of benches:)
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: The end product is stable and sturdy. We wanted a garden bench and this is ...
customer_reviews.text: What a nifty product. From open the box to bench took about 20 minutes to cut the boards, put in screws and...it's done! . We used pre-treated 2x4's. The end product is stable and sturdy. We wanted a garden bench and this is great. Really pleased with the product. May just buy a couple of sets for two small deck tables to use beside chairs on the deck.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a posing bench for photographing sports teams ... Got plans to build out of wood ... And I'm not that handy ... Saw this and bought it. Went to Lowes and got the 5 pieces of 2 x 4 cut to the right length - had a sturdy bench built in a about an hour! Painted up really nice and it works very well with 6-8 kids sitting on it - very sturdy - and my wife thinks I'm a genius - Thanks Amazon ...
customer_reviews.author: Phillie Rawb

customer_reviews.title: Good stools!!!
customer_reviews.text: These stools are relatively easy to assemble. They are sturdy and look pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: James Southard

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good weather proof bench when combined with recycled plastic lumber
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good weather proof bench when combined with recycled plastic lumber. I used this cedar color from www.polyproducts.com (call your order in or the freight cost will be more than the lumber). Total cost about $100
customer_reviews.author: JimO

customer_reviews.title: excellent bench molds
customer_reviews.text: love the foot molds. It takes all the guess work out of making a bench. Just make sure the wood you purchase is in decent shape. Make sure you're ok with the knots and other imperfections found on all lumber. Use a rubber mallet if things get tight . a few screws zipped in and you're good to go. It can get heavy so an extra pair hands to help is always nice.
customer_reviews.author: Justchillin

customer_reviews.title: Ughh ok cool
customer_reviews.text: I literally thought this was a whole bench... defiantly not the case lol but hey seeing the glass half full it’s something I can do with my daughter .. so all else fails build your own bench. The supports for the wood have a weird angle to drill into the wood kind of at a angel. Weird
customer_reviews.author: alysia gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing .I looked everywhere for benches and they are so pricey. I needed 2 which is cost prohibitive. Got these and I can do them by myself, at 63 yrs old, paint and size for what I need. Love this . Will make more.
customer_reviews.author: Huntress

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, really nice finished product. I'm a little worried that the screws provided are not long enough, but no trouble yet. It is fairly versatile, too. It is designed for 2 x 4 's, but I easily used 2 x 6's to get slightly different dimensions for short table. Will use 2 x 4's for the other two I bought and make them into benches about 4 feet long.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: More than just benches
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to put my container gardens on, mainly to keep our puppy from digging in them. Unfortunately they weren't tall enough and we had to move them outside of the fence to save my veggies from her, but they now save my veggies from rabbits. Not visually stunning, but I wouldn't call them displeasing to the eye. Should we ever decide to, we can turn them into handy benches. Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Swingin Island Doc

customer_reviews.title: was skeptical
customer_reviews.text: I was willing to take a chance given the price, I'm glad I did. I wanted a short (2 1/2 foot long) bench for my garden area. this kit, some pressure treated lumber and 10 minutes of my husband's time... done! its no work of art, but its sturdy, functional, easy to assemble and relatively affordable for a custom sized bench. it hasn't gone outside yet, that will be the next test.
customer_reviews.author: Old Town Mom

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Look and work great heavy duty. Easy to build if you have a saw and sander to prepare the boards to the brackets.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: This is called a "table, " it is not ...
customer_reviews.text: This is called a "table," it is not very high. I would say it is the level of a bench. That's what ours came out to be. Check sizing before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Short and small bench
customer_reviews.text: The stands for the bench kind of short. And it does not come with wood. Just comes witb legs or the stand bench. And it's made out of Plastic. I not buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

product_meta.title: 2x4basics 90140 AnySize Table, Sand
product_meta.description: Color:AnySize Table, SandThe Hopkins 90140 2x4basics AnySize Table or Low Bench can allow you to custom build a very sturdy picnic bench or low table, coffee table, side table, or footrest up to 8 feet (2.4m). Comes in a sand color, this versatile design makes the Any Size Table a good value for your outdoor furniture needs. You can store it as a side table or footrest and then use it as an extra bench when your seating requirements increase. Simple assembly with only a powered screwdriver and a saw, (lumber not included). No miter or angle cuts necessary, a handy downloadable cutting template is provided on our website. The Hopkins Any Size Table is made of durable and maintenance free structural resin. The assembled unit stands 17 inches (433mm) tall and 15 inches (381mm) wide, you choose the length. By combining the Any Size Table with the Outdoor Dining Table and Any Size Chair or Flip Top Bench Table, you can create functional and attractive outdoor furniture groupings.
feature_bullets: Lumber not included with each kit
Build your own low table, side table, or coffee table any size up to 8 ft
Brackets made of heavy gauge structural resin
All hardware is included, assemble with only a screwdriver
Includes 2 bench end supports, hardware, and assembly instructions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars936 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
